scientific_name: Buddleja davidii 'PIIBD-I' FIRST EDITIONS GROOVY GRAPE

hardiness_location.full_iframe: <iframe frameborder=0 scrolling=yes seamless=seamless width=1000 height=550 style='margin:auto;' src='https://perenual.com/api/hardiness-map?species_id=1380&size=og&key=sk-kMpx68b02586bb61112084'></iframe>

description: The Butterfly Bush, or Buddleja davidii 'PIIBD-I' FIRST EDITIONS GROOVY GRAPE, is an amazing flowering shrub. It produces vibrant grape-colored, conical blooms that attract butterflies and other pollinators. It also has an attractive purple foliage, making it a great choice for ornamental gardens. This hardy, drought-resistant variety is low-maintenance, requiring minimal pruning and care, and will thrive in most sunny locations. Its fine texture and aromatic, fragrant flowers make it an excellent addition to any landscape, adding a beautiful splash of color, texture and scent.
